722262f.text:
Park Avenue, east side, between 54th and 53rd Streets, showing No. 383, one of the earliest modern apartment houses in this section, nearing completion.
Another one will shortly rise alongside it, and one in the block immediately to the South, from 53rd to 52nd Streets, where the Steinway Factory has just been demolished; but the small house on the N.E. corner of 53rd Street will not be replaced till 1924.
1911.

722264f.text:
Park Ave., east side, south from East 54th to 53rd Streets. The new1y erected building shown, is No. 383 Park Ave.
About 1915.

722265f.text:
Park Ave., east side, south from East 54th to 53rd Streets. This ia a
negative copy showing prominently No. 383.
About 1915.

722258f-b.text:
Park Averue, north on west side, from 53rd to 57th Streetg.showing the block of small buildings much older than their surroundings. Compare with Ewing Gallowey's photographs of Park Avenue north
from 52nd Street in 1905 and in 1932.
Note construction Poing on in 53rd street; s branch of the new municipal subway is being tunnelled under 53rd Street.
April 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
The same, showing a view farther north. The block of small old houses from East 53rd to East 54th Streets has been replaced by a one-story
building to be used for stores.
February 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

722263f.text:
383 Park Avenue, east side, between E. 53rd and E. 54th Streets,
showing newly erected twelve story apartments.
MAY BE REPRODUCED  about 1930

722257f-a.text:
Park Avenue, ePat side, from 53rd to 55th Streets, seen from a tall
roof at yadison Avenue on 5Bnd Street.

722259f-a.text:
Park Ave., west side, north from East 53rd (lower left), to 59th (center right) Streets, as seen from the General Electric Building (570 Lexington Ave)., at the S.W. corner of East 5lst Street. Also shown is a general view northwestward over the Plaza and CentralPark area with
their hotel and apartment house fringe.
December 1, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

722259f-b.text:
Park Ave., west side, north from East 53rd (lower left), to 59th (center right) Streets, as seen from the General Electric Building (570 Lexington Ave)., at the S.W. corner of East 5lst Street. Also shown is a general view northwestward over the Plaza and CentralPark area with
their hotel and apartment house fringe.

722252f.text:
Park Ave., north from East 53rd Street. Buildings lining both sides of this avenue are mainly apartment houses. The spired building at the N.E. corner of 57th Street is the Ritr Tower, an apartment hoteh.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
